{{redirect|Jordan (model)|the 1970s model|Pamela Rooke}} {{EngvarB|date=June 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2015}} {{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox person |name = Katie Price |image = Katie Price, 2014.jpg |caption = Katie Price pictured in 2014 |birth_name = Katrina Amy Alexandra Alexis Infield |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1978|05|22}} |birth_place = [[Brighton]], [[East Sussex]], England |death_date = |death_place = |residence = |nationality = British |other_names = {{nowrap|Jordan (pseudonym)
Katie Andre (married name)
Katie Reid (married name)}}
Katie Hayler (married name) |occupation = [[Businessperson|Businesswoman]], singer, television personality, novelist, model |years_active = 1996–present |height = {{height|ft=5|in=5}} |spouse = {{marriage|[[Peter Andre]]|2005|2009|end=divorced}}
{{marriage|[[Alex Reid (fighter)|Alex Reid]]|2010|2011|end=divorced}}
{{marriage|Kieran Hayler|2013|}} |children = 5 |networth = {{gain}} [[Pound sterling|£]]40 million
(US$66.76 million) (est.) |homepage = {{url|katieprice.co.uk}} }} '''Katie Price''' (born '''Katrina Amy Alexandra Alexis Infield'''; 22 May 1978), previously known by the pseudonym '''Jordan''', is an English television personality, model, author, singer, designer and businesswoman. She was the winner of the [[Celebrity Big Brother 15|fifteenth series]] of ''[[Celebrity Big Brother (UK TV series)|Celebrity Big Brother]]''. Katie Price was runner-up in the search for the UK's entry for the Eurovision Song Contest in 2005. In 2012, Price's net worth was estimated at [[Pound sterling|£]]45 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/2012/04/15/1-katie-price-33-reality-tv-45m-5m-102039-23825141/ |title=1 Katie Price, 33, (reality TV) £45m (+£5m) – UK & World News |publisher=People.co.uk |date=15 April 2012 |accessdate=23 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114051739/http://www.people.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/2012/04/15/1-katie-price-33-reality-tv-45m-5m-102039-23825141/ |archivedate=14 November 2012 |df= }} ==Early life== Born in 1978 in [[Brighton]], East Sussex, southeast England,{{cite news|last=Harding|first=Nick|title=My Secret Life: Katie Price|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/my-secret-life-katie-price-34-entrepreneur-7956872.html|accessdate=1 August 2012|newspaper=The Independent Magazine|date=21 July 2012|location=London}} Katie Price was the only child of Amy (née Charlier) and Ray Infield.{{cite web|title=Katie Price: Celeb Profile |url=http://www.ok.co.uk/posts/view/1341/Katie-Price |work=OK! |accessdate=6 November 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110723101113/http://www.ok.co.uk/posts/view/1341/Katie-Price |archivedate=23 July 2011 |df=dmy-all }} Her father left the family when she was four, and in 1988 her mother married builder Paul Price, after which she acquired the surname Price.{{cite news|title=Katie Price: Life on the red-top roundabout|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/news/katie-price-life-on-the-redtop-roundabout-1887887.html|author=Dickinson, Matt|work=The Independent |location=UK |date=3 February 2010|accessdate=6 November 2010}} She has an older half-brother named Daniel and a younger half-sister named Sophie.{{Cite book|last=Price|first=Katie|title=Being Jordan: My Autobiography|publisher=John Blake|year=2006|pages=2–4|isbn=1-84454-224-6}} Her maternal grandmother was Jewish, but she is not religious.[https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/katie-price-we-love-to-earn-money-who-doesnt-955318.html Katie Price: 'We love to earn money, who doesn't?'] The Independent, INTERVIEW BY DEBORAH ROSS Saturday 11 October 2008 Price attended [[Blatchington Mill School and Sixth Form College|Blatchington Mill School]]{{Cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/uk/katie-prices-old-school-set-to-give-students-an-extra-hour-in-bed-a3457191.html|title=Katie Price's old school set to give students an extra hour in bed|date=2017-02-03|work=Evening Standard|access-date=2017-03-31|language=en-GB}} She excelled at sport, swimming for Sussex in regional competitions. During her childhood, she also developed a passion for horses and horse-riding. She began modelling as a child, and at 13 she modelled for a clothing line.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/in_depth/uk/2000/newsmakers/2166948.stm|title=Jordan: Fronting up|publisher=BBC News |date=2 August 2002|accessdate=6 November 2010|first=Bob|last=Chaundy}} ==Career== ===Modelling=== [[File:Katie Price at Clothes Show Live.jpg|thumb|left|Katie Price in 2009]] At a friend's suggestion, Price had professional photographs taken and decided to pursue a modelling career.{{cite web|title=History |url=http://katieprice.co.uk/history |publisher=Official Kate Price Website |accessdate=6 November 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101102012712/http://katieprice.co.uk/history |archivedate= 2 November 2010 |df= }} The pictures were sent to a modelling agency in London, and in 1996 she appeared in ''[[Page 3]]'', a female glamour model pictorial in British newspaper ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]''.{{cite book|last=Banker|first=Leslie |author2=Mullins, William|title=Britannia in Brief: The Scoop on All Things British|publisher=Random House, Inc.|year=2009|pages=61, 67|isbn=0-345-50999-4}} As Jordan, Price was famed for her surgically enhanced breasts. At 19 she had the first in a succession of [[breast implant|breast-enhancement surgeries]], increasing her natural 32B to a 32FF. She also regularly appeared in the ''[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]'', ''[[FHM]]'', the British edition of ''[[Playboy]]'', ''Nuts'', ''Maxim'', ''Loaded'', ''[[Vogue (British magazine)|Vogue]]'' and ''[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]]'' and also ran as a candidate in [[Stretford and Urmston (UK Parliament constituency)|Stretford and Urmston]] during the [[United Kingdom general election, 2001|British General Election]] in 2001.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/vote2001/hi/english/newsid_1360000/1360650.stm|title=Jordan Presses the Flesh|accessdate=18 April 2007|date=31 May 2001|publisher=BBC News }} She ended up winning 713 votes, 1.8% of the votes cast.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/vote2001/hi/english/newsid_1371000/1371483.stm|title=Independent Doctor Triumphs|accessdate=18 April 2007|date=8 June 2001|publisher=BBC News }} In 2002, she appeared on the September cover of the American edition of Playboy magazine.{{cite web |url=http://uk.askmen.com/celebs/women/models_100/113_katie_price.html |title=Katie Price Video, Pictures, Gallery – AskMen UK |publisher=Uk.askmen.com |accessdate=31 December 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120117082413/http://uk.askmen.com/celebs/women/models_100/113_katie_price.html |archive-date=17 January 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} Price continues to model today,{{when?|date=March 2018}} {{cns|date=March 2018|though she has dropped the name Jordan.}} ===Television=== Price made cameo appearances as herself in the television dramas ''[[Dream Team (TV series)|Dream Team]]'' and ''[[Footballers' Wives]]'' in 2004. Price also appeared on ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]'''s "[[Star in a Reasonably Priced Car]]" in 2004. She completed the lap in one minute and fifty-two seconds.{{cite episode |title=Series 4, Episode 3 |series=Top Gear (UK) |network=[[BBC]] |date=23 May 2004}} Price appeared on ''[[The Big Breakfast]]'' in her earlier career and was a guest host on the first series of ''[[The Sunday Night Project|The Friday Night Project]]''. In December 2005, she released an exercise fitness DVD, ''The Jordan Workout'', featuring "The Juice Master" [[Jason Vale]].{{Citation|last=Callender|first=Richard|title=The Jordan Workout|date=2005-12-26|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0963304/|last2=Price|last3=Vale|first2=Katie|first3=Jason|accessdate=2017-03-31}} Price was a contestant on the [[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK series 3)|third series]] of ''[[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK TV series)|I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!]]'', a reality television series where a group of celebrities live together in a [[jungle]] environment with few luxuries, between the months of January and February in 2004. It was there that she met Peter Andre whom she would eventually marry and later divorce. In 2007, Price hosted the short-lived late-night chat show ''Katie & Peter: Unleashed'' with her former husband Peter Andre. In November 2009, Price made a return visit to ''I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!'' in its [[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK series 9)|ninth series]]. Presenters [[Ant & Dec]] insinuated during the broadcast that the surprise of Price's return had been ruined by the media.{{cite web|url=http://celebrity.itv.com/2009/DailyNews/katies-jungle-return-1140 |title=Katie's Jungle Return |accessdate=15 November 2009 |date=15 November 2009 |publisher=ITV.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091120053055/http://celebrity.itv.com/2009/DailyNews/katies-jungle-return-1140 |archivedate=20 November 2009 |df= }} She has also been the subject of many reality television series that chronicle her domestic life. This started with a trio of Channel 4 documentaries by film-maker Richard Macer: ''Jordan: The Truth About Me'' (2002), ''Jordan: The Model Mum'' and ''Jordan: You Don't Even Know Me'' (both 2004), and was followed ''Jordan Gets Even'' on Five in 2004. She later appeared in the documentary ''Jordan: Living With a Dream '' (Channel 4) and then launched the ''Katie & Peter'' franchise on [[ITV2]] which documented the lives of Price and former husband Peter Andre. This franchise included several fly-on-the-wall reality series which comprised ''When Jordan Met Peter'', ''Jordan & Peter: Laid Bare'' and ''Jordan & Peter: Marriage and Mayhem'' between 2004 and 2005; ''Katie & Peter: The Next Chapter'', ''Katie & Peter: The Baby Diaries'' and ''Katie & Peter: Unleashed'' in 2007; ''Katie & Peter: Down Under'' and ''Katie & Peter: African Adventures'' in 2008; and ''Katie & Peter: Stateside'' in 2009.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/6913310.stm|title=Jordan decides on daughter's name|accessdate=24 July 2007|date=24 July 2007|publisher=BBC News }}{{cite news|url=http://lifeandhealth.guardian.co.uk/celebrity/story/0,,2267023,00.html|title=Who wants to be a billionaire?|last=Hattenstone|first=Simon |work=The Guardian|accessdate=6 July 2008| date=22 March 2008 | location=London}} {{cns|date=March 2017|The pair's separation in 2009 resulted in their individual shows being recorded: ''What Katie Did Next'' continued on ITV2 until 2011.}} Price danced with her then-boyfriend Leandro Penna on the Argentine television programme ''[[Bailando 2012|Bailando por un Sueño 2012]]'', a spin-off of ''Strictly Come Dancing''. In 2015, Price appeared on the [[Celebrity Big Brother 15|fifteenth series]] of ''[[Celebrity Big Brother (UK TV series)|Celebrity Big Brother]]''. She had been previously invited to appear on the show.{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D1hj1LLibIg|title=Exclusive Katie Price interview|date=16 January 2015|publisher=|via=YouTube}} On 6 February 2015, Price finished as the winner of the series.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s150/celebrity-big-brother/news/a627345/katie-price-wins-celebrity-big-brother-2015-katie-hopkins-is-runner-up.html#~pixaQiRcPPzJ7P|title=Katie Price wins Celebrity Big Brother|date=6 February 2015|work=Digital Spy}} ===Writing=== Price has also established herself in the publishing industry.David Sexton [https://www.standard.co.uk/lifestyle/katie-price-knows-how-to-kiss-and-sell-6764040.html "Katie Price knows how to kiss and sell"], ''London Evening Standard'', 2 September 2009 She was in the top 100 best selling authors of the decade for book sales between 2000 and 2009, with nearly three millions sales.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/books/6866648/Bestselling-authors-of-the-decade.html|title=Bestselling authors of the decade|first=Brian|last=MacArthur|date=22 December 2009|publisher=|accessdate=17 September 2018|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}} In 2012, she was listed as 24th in the list of the 50 best-selling authors in Britain based on Nielsen BookScan statistics since 1998.{{cite web|url=http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/celebritymoney/article-2200999/Jamie-Oliver-JK-Rowling-50-biggest-selling-authors-time.html|title=Writing their way into a fortune: the top 50 biggest-selling authors of all time|publisher=|accessdate=17 September 2018}} She released her first autobiography ''Being Jordan'' in May 2004. She conducted a 10-day book-signing tour which helped to propel her to first position in the [[Nielsen BookScan]] hardback sales chart and to sell 97,090 copies in one year; and over 1,000,000 as of January 2007.{{cite news|last= Barkham|first= Patrick|title= I'm famous, buy me|work=The Guardian |location=UK |date= 15 January 2007|url= http://books.guardian.co.uk/departments/biography/story/0,,1990564,00.html }}{{cite news|last=Kean |first=Danuta |title=Bookshop Bingo! |work=[[The Independent|Independent on Sunday]] |publisher=FindArticles.com |date=24 September 2006 |url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4159/is_20060924/ai_n16748279 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151017185926/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4159/is_20060924/ai_n16748279 |archivedate=17 October 2015 |df= }}{{cite web|last= Dolby|first = Trevor|title= Publishing confessions|work=Prospect Magazine|date=January 2007|url= http://www.prospect-magazine.co.uk/printarticle.php?id=8148}} Her second autobiography, ''A Whole New World'', was published in January 2006. It reached number two in the hardback general category and sold 198,105 copies by 1 April 2006.{{cite news|title = The Sunday Times bestsellers|work=The Sunday Times |location=UK |date = 9 April 2006|url= http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/books/article702048.ece|first=Fiona|last=Hamilton}} Her second novel, ''Crystal'', about a young woman's efforts to become a singer, sold 159,407 copies during the first three months after its release in June 2007.{{cite news|last= Lusher|first= Adam|title = Man Booker Prize 2007: Why Jordan is better read than Ian McEwan|work=The Daily Telegraph |location=UK |date= 23 September 2007|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/arts/main.jhtml?xml=/arts/2007/09/23/boprice123.xml }}{{cite news|url= http://observer.guardian.co.uk/review/story/0,,1733919,00.html|title= The pen pushers|author=Tim Adams|date= 19 March 2006|work=The Observer |location=UK }}{{cite news|url= http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/columnists/guest_contributors/article2097967.ece|title= Let's hear it for Katie Price, role model|author=Carol Midgley|date= 19 July 2007|work=The Times |location=UK }} In July 2008, Price released her third novel, ''Angel Uncovered''. In July 2009, Price released a novel entitled ''Sapphire'' which was number 1 on the hardback fiction chart for four consecutive weeks and sold 42,215 copies in its first two weeks in the UK alone.[https://www.theguardian.com/books/series/bestsellers Bestsellers] ''The Guardian'' {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330041207/https://www.theguardian.com/books/series/bestsellers |date=30 March 2017 }} Price released her fifth novel, ''Paradise'', in July 2010.{{Cite web|url=http://www.goodreads.com/book/show/7571543-paradise|title=Paradise (Angel Summer, #3)|website=Goodreads|access-date=2017-03-31}}. In 2014, Katie Price released her tenth novel "Make My Wish Come True".{{cite news | url=http://www.ikonlondonmagazine.com/kate-price-make-my-wish-come-true-book-launch/ | title= Ikon London Magazine coverage from the press launch | publisher= Ikon London Magazine | date= 26 October 2014 | accessdate= 8 March 2018}} In 2006 Price signed a £300,000 advance with Random House for ''Katie Price's Perfect Ponies'', {{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Katie-Prices-Perfect-Ponies-Pony/dp/1862303657 |title=Katie Price's Perfect Ponies: My Pony Care Book My Perfect Pony: Katie Price|publisher=Amazon.com |accessdate=19 May 2009}} a series of children's books, with the first 6 released in 2007. New book in the series have been released ongoing, with 12 in total as of 2017.{{Dead link|date=May 2009}}{{cite news|last= Forrest|first= Susanna|title= Why girls still sign up for the pony club|work=The Daily Telegraph |location=UK |date= 14 July 2007|url= https://www.telegraph.co.uk/arts/main.jhtml?xml=/arts/2007/07/14/bopony114.xml }} Price's daughter Princess landed her own book deal at just nine years old in 2017.https://www.familiesonline.co.uk/life/news/katie-prices-daughter-lands-book-deal Price had a regular advice column in ''[[OK!]]'' magazine until 2009.{{cite web|url=http://skyliving.sky.com/another-split-for-katie-price |title=Jordan Katie Price No More OK! Magazine Column Morgan Awards – Sky Living HD |publisher=BSkyB |date=2 December 2009 |accessdate=23 October 2012}} In 2012, she landed her own column in ''The Sun on Sunday''.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a367842/katie-price-lands-sun-on-sunday-column.html |title=Katie Price lands 'Sun on Sunday' column – Showbiz News |work=Digital Spy |date=25 February 2012 |accessdate=23 October 2012}} ===Music=== Price was runner-up in the selection contest for [[United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest|a representative for the United Kingdom]] at the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2005|2005 Eurovision Song Contest]]. The selection process, named ''Making Your Mind Up'', was broadcast live on television in March 2005. Price sang a song titled "Not Just Anybody".{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/4319169.stm|title=Javine wins UK Eurovision contest|accessdate=18 March 2007|date=5 March 2005|publisher=BBC News }} In July 2010, Price released "[[Free to Love Again]]", a non-album single. About the release, she explained: "I'm not a singer, this is just something that I'm doing for fun. It's not like I'm worried about getting a chart position or number one, this is purely for fun. Whether people like it or not, I'm doing it."{{cite web|title=Katie Price nervously mimes Free To Love Again on TV for the first time|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/tv/835303-katie-price-nervously-mimes-free-to-love-again-on-tv-for-the-first-time|date=16 July 2010|accessdate=6 November 2010|author=Duncan, Amy}} ===Fashion and beauty=== She brought out her first perfume, "Stunning", in 2007.{{cite web|url=http://jigsawesl.com/brands/celeb/katy-price/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120130142815/http://jigsawesl.com/brands/celeb/katy-price/|archive-date=30 January 2012|title=Katie Price|website=Jigsaw ESL}} ===Equestrian clothing range=== In 2008, Price signed a deal with Derby House to launch her equestrian range of clothing named "KP Equestrian".{{cite web|url= http://www.peterboroughtoday.co.uk/features/Jordan-brings-a-touch-of.4461604.jp|title= Jordan brings a touch of glamour to equestrian clothing|accessdate=8 November 2008|author=Hannah Gray|date=5 September 2008|work=[[Peterborough Evening Telegraph]]}} In 2009 Price was named as the patron of a charity polo match played near [[Epping, Essex|Epping]], Essex.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/essex/8112474.stm|title=Katie Price named as polo patron|publisher=BBC Essex|date=22 June 2009 |accessdate=26 September 2009}} ===Stage=== It was announced on 9 July 2017 that Price would go on her first UK tour with ''An audience with Katie Price'' the tour will last 15 shows and will begin in Preston on 1 September 2017 and will finish in Southend on 16 December 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BWVRXt7gPsS/?taken-by=officialkatieprice&hl=en|title=Katie Price on Instagram: “Pleased to announce my UK Tour "An audience with Katie Price" Tickets on sale now from the venues ticket sites/box office - Book now”|website=Instagram|accessdate=17 September 2018}} == Personal life == === Marriages === Price and [[Peter Andre]] got together after spending time on ''I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!'', and they married in September 2005 at [[Highclere Castle]], Hampshire. In May 2009 they announced that they were separating.{{cite web|url= http://www.ok.co.uk/celebnews/view/10187/Katie-Price-and-Peter-Andre-split/|title=Katie Price and Peter Andre announce split|accessdate=11 May 2009|date=11 May 2009|work=OK!}}{{cite web|url= http://www.ok.co.uk/celebnews/view/10195/Katie-Pete-left-me-I-m-devastated/|title=Katie: Pete left me and I’m devastated|accessdate=11 May 2009|date=11 May 2009|work=OK!}}[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/celebritynews/5799120/Katie-Price-suffered-miscarriage-a-month-before-split-from-Peter-Andre.html Katie Price suffered miscarriage a month before split from Peter Andre] ''The Daily Telegraph'', 11 July 2009 In July 2009, Price began dating [[Mixed martial arts|MMA]] fighter and former ''[[Hollyoaks]]'' actor [[Alex Reid (fighter)|Alex Reid]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/a167353/price-spends-night-with-ex-soap-actor.html|title=Price spends night with ex-soap actor|date=26 July 2009|accessdate=7 September 2009}} On 2 February 2010, Price married Reid in a private ceremony in [[Las Vegas Strip|Las Vegas]] at the chapel in the [[Wynn Hotel]].{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/8494848.stm|title=Model Katie Price married Alex Reid in Vegas|date=2 February 2010|publisher=BBC News }} They later also formally married in a church in the UK; the ceremony was filmed for her TV series. They separated in January 2011.{{cite web|author=3 am |url=http://www.3am.co.uk/jordan-planning-to-announce-formal-separation-from-alex-reid-next-month/25595/ |title=Alex Reid has got one month to attempt to infiltrate the cold, hard shell of Jordan's emotions – Gasp! |publisher=3am |accessdate=31 December 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110728064426/http://www.3am.co.uk/jordan-planning-to-announce-formal-separation-from-alex-reid-next-month/25595/ |archivedate=28 July 2011 |df= }} She married Kieran Hayler, at the Sandals Royal Bahamian Resort and Spa in the [[Bahamas]] on 16 January 2013. Hayler proposed on Christmas Day 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a451938/katie-price-a-psychic-told-me-id-marry-a-kevin-kieran-is-close.html|title=Katie Price: 'A psychic told me I'd marry a Kevin, Kieran is close'|work=Digital Spy}}{{cite web|title=Katie Price announces her Divorce with Kieran Hayler|url=http://news.biharprabha.com/2014/05/katie-price-announces-her-divorce-with-kieran-hayler/|agency=Indo-Asian News Service|publisher=news.biharprabha.com|accessdate=7 May 2014}} She has since separated from Kieran. === Children === Katie Price gave birth to her first child, son Harvey Price, in Brighton in May 2002. Harvey's father is former [[Association football|footballer]] [[Dwight Yorke]]. Harvey was found to be [[blindness|blind]], having a condition known as [[septo-optic dysplasia]], meaning that the development of his [[optic nerve]] was unpredictable. As he has matured, she has also discovered that he is on the [[Autism spectrum|autistic spectrum]], gains weight easily because he suffers from [[Prader–Willi syndrome]], and finds walking difficult.{{cite web|url=http://living.scotsman.com/index.cfm?id=173652006 |title=Two faces of Jordan |accessdate=18 March 2007 |author=Catherine Deveney |date=5 February 2006 |work=The Scotsman |location=UK |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070205194741/http://living.scotsman.com/index.cfm?id=173652006 |archivedate=5 February 2007 |df=dmy-all }} In June 2005, she gave birth by [[Caesarean section]] to her second son, Junior Savva Andreas Andre. In June 2007, she gave birth to her third child, daughter Princess Tiaamii Crystal Esther Andre.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/6913310.stm|title=Jordan decides on daughter's name|accessdate=24 July 2007|date=24 July 2007|publisher=BBC News }} In August 2013, Price gave birth to her third son, Jett Riviera Hayler. On 4 August 2014, she gave birth to a second daughter, Bunny Hayler, two weeks prematurely.{{Cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/style/celebrity/celebrity-news/katie-price-shares-first-picture-of-newborn-daughter-30485790.html|title=Katie Price shares first picture of newborn daughter|accessdate=5 August 2014|date=5 August 2014|work=The Irish Independent}} === Surgery === In 2002, Price was treated for a [[leiomyosarcoma]] on her finger. The cancerous tumour was removed at a [[Nuffield Health|Nuffield Hospital]] near her Brighton home.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/2185943.stm|title=Jordan treated for cancer|accessdate=18 March 2007|date=11 August 2002|publisher=BBC News }} In December 2007, Price underwent surgery in the United States to reduce the size of her breast implants and also had [[rhinoplasty]]. However, she was not happy with the results of her breast implants, so returned to Beverly Hills, California in July 2008 for corrective surgery. She returned to the United Kingdom with much smaller size 32C breasts.{{cite web|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/showbiz/article-23429284-details/Downsizing+Jordan:+How+Katie+Price+shrank+her+assets+in+time+for+Christmas/article.do |title=Downsizing Jordan: How Katie Price shrank her assets in time for Christmas |accessdate=20 February 2008 |date=27 December 2007 |work=London Evening Standard |location=UK |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090803092317/http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/showbiz/article-23429284-details/Downsizing%20Jordan%3A%20How%20Katie%20Price%20shrank%20her%20assets%20in%20time%20for%20Christmas/article.do |archivedate=3 August 2009 |df=dmy-all }} === Legal issues === In September 2009, Price claimed that she had previously been raped by a "famous celebrity", but had not reported the incident. Price insisted that she would "absolutely never" reveal who the attacker was.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/surrey/8261575.stm|title=Price contacted over rape claim |date=17 September 2009|publisher=BBC News |accessdate=17 September 2009}} [[Surrey Police]] stated that they had not contacted Price: "No allegation of rape has been made and Miss Price will not be making a statement to police".{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/surrey/8262226.stm|title=Price not quizzed over rape claim|date=18 September 2009|publisher=BBC News |accessdate=18 September 2009}} === Personal debt === In August 2018 Price was able to avoid [[bankruptcy]] after a High Court hearing was adjourned to give her three months to pay off her debts, reportedly totalling more than £250,000, nearly a tenth of which is tax. Price did not attend court, but submitted proposals for an [[Individual voluntary arrangement|Individual Voluntary Arrangemnt]] (IVA), whereby creditors are repaid over a period of time.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/family/relationships/rise-fall-katie-price/|title=The rise and fall of Katie Price|first=Mark|last=Frith|date=7 August 2018|publisher=|accessdate=17 September 2018|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}}{{cite web|url=https://www.ok.co.uk/celebrity-news/1435781/katie-price-bankruptcy-money-net-worth-court-hearing-kris-boyson|title=Katie Price avoids bankruptcy and is given 12 weeks to pay back debts|first=Alana|last=Anderson|date=7 August 2018|publisher=|accessdate=17 September 2018}} == Discography == '''Albums''' {| class=wikitable style=text-align:center; |- ! rowspan=2| Year ! rowspan=2| Album !| Peak

page.title: List of international sports events in Australia

revision.text:
{{Use Australian English|date=September 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2015}} Australia has a rich history of bidding for and hosting major international [[multi-sport event]]s and [[world championship]]s. It has hosted two [[Summer Olympics]], one [[Summer Paralympics]] and three [[Commonwealth Games]]. In 2018, it will be hosting [[2018 Commonwealth Games]]. ==Background== [[Australian Government]] provides funding for the hosting of major sports events in Australia. It provided $247.3 million in funding for the hosting of the [[2000 Summer Olympics|2000 Sydney Olympics]] and [[2000 Summer Paralympics|Paralympics]].{{cite web|last1=Jolly|first1=Rhonda|title=Sports funding: federal balancing act|url=http://www.aph.gov.au/About_Parliament/Parliamentary_Departments/Parliamentary_Library/pubs/BN/2012-2013/SportFunding#_Toc360096383|website=Praliamentary Library|accessdate=18 February 2015}} In recent years, it has provided funding to [[2015 Asian Cup]], [[2015 Cricket World Cup]], [[2015 Netball World Cup]] and [[2018 Commonwealth Games]].{{cite web|title=Major Sports Events|url=http://www.health.gov.au/internet/main/publishing.nsf/Content/sport-events|website=Dept. of Health website|accessdate=18 February 2015}} For the 2015 Cricket World Cup, it provided $14 million in funding.{{cite web|title=International cricket community arrives in Australia|url=http://www.health.gov.au/internet/ministers/publishing.nsf/Content/health-mediarel-yr2015-ley009.htm|website=Dept. of Health website|accessdate=18 February 2015}} Its objectives in providing funding were to inspire Australian children to be active as well as providing a boost to the economy. The event held in both Australia and New Zealand was expected to inject $360 million directly into both economies. Several [[Australian states and territories|Australian state and territory]] governments have established major event organisations to assist in the bidding and financing for major international sporting events in Australia. Their objectives are to improve their economies through tourism and further develop community and sporting facilities. Examples of these organisations are [[Victorian Major Events Company]], [[Events New South Wales]] and [[Tourism and Events Queensland]]. The cost of bidding and hosting sporting events has sometimes come under scrutiny. It was reported that Melbourne's 2014 [[Australian Formula 1 Grand Prix]] cost taxpayers almost $60 million. This was an additional $9.3 million than 2013 and due to declining ticket sales and increased costs.{{cite news|last1=Redrup|first1=Yolanda|title=Costs of staging Melbourne Formula One Grand Prix increase again|url=http://www.theage.com.au/victoria/costs-of-staging-melbourne-formula-one-grand-prix-increase-again-20140910-10evs1.html|accessdate=18 February 2015|work=The Age|date=10 September 2014}} Australia unsuccessfully bidded for he [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] and [[2022 FIFA World Cup]]s. The bid was managed by the [[Football Federation of Australia]] and was granted $42 million in Australian Government funding.{{cite web|last1=Morris|first1=Madeleine|title=Senate to vote on possible inquiry into Australia's unsuccessful World Cup 2022 bid|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2014-12-22/senate-to-vote-on-inquiry-into-unsuccessful-world-cup-2022-bid/5983756|website=ABC News, 23 December 2014|accessdate=18 February 2015}} The bid came under scrutiny as only one vote out of 22 of the FIFA Executive Committee members was obtained and the ethics of Australia's bidding process. ==International multi-sport competitions== Includes international multi-sport events that are held on a regular schedule. {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Dates !International Event !City ! Sports !Countries ! Competitors ! {{Infobox stadium | stadium_name = Charles McCulloch Stadium | nickname = | image = McCullochStadium.JPG | image_size = 240px | location = 890 Mission Street SE
[[Salem, Oregon]] 97301 | broke_ground = | opened = 1950 | renovated = 1993 | owner = [[Willamette University]] | operator = Willamette University | surface = FieldTurf | construction_cost = | architect = | former_names = | tenants = Willamette University ([[NCAA]])
[[Portland Timbers U23s]] ([[USL League Two|USL L2]]) (2017–) | seating_capacity = 2,500 | website = }} '''McCulloch Stadium''' is a 2,500-seat outdoor stadium in [[Salem, Oregon]], [[United States]]. Built in 1950, the multi-use facility serves as home to [[Willamette University]]'s football and track & field teams, and [[high school]] football games. Located in [[Bush's Pasture Park]] south of Willamette's campus, the stadium includes a grandstand, football field, and track. ==History== Charles E. McCulloch donated $50,000 to the school in June 1947 in order to build an athletic complex on {{convert|10|acres}} at what is now Bush's Pasture Park.{{cite news|title=$50,000 Received By Willamette|newspaper=The Oregonian|date=June 16, 1947|page=5}} At the time, McCulloch was president of the university's board of trustees and an attorney in [[Portland, Oregon|Portland]] where he was a partner at what is now [[Stoel Rives]].{{cite web|title=Timeline|url=http://www.stoel.com/Anniversary_Timeline.aspx|work=Anniversary|publisher=Stoel Rives LLP|accessdate=29 June 2013}} The proposed stadium was to have seating for 3,500 in a concrete grandstand, plus a baseball diamond, track, and practice field for the football team. Construction began in March 1950 with it planned to be completed in time for that year's football season.{{cite news|title=Bearcats Get New Stadium|newspaper=The Oregonian|date=March 5, 1950|page=4}} It was also announced the stadium would be named for Charles E. McCulloch and have a total capacity of 7,000. On October 14, 1950, a dedication ceremony was held with school president [[G. Herbert Smith]] and Oregon governor [[Douglas McKay]] on hand to welcome [[Hawaii Warriors football|Hawaii]] and honor the 1941 Willamette team that was stranded in Hawaii after the [[attack on Pearl Harbor]].{{cite news|title=N.W. Conference Clubs Await Full Saturday Slate|newspaper=The Oregonian|date=October 14, 1950|page=The Oregonian; Date: 10–14-1950;}} The [[New York Giants]] football team held their first scrimmage of the 1958 season at the stadium on July 31.{{cite news|title=NY Giants Hold First Scrimmage|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=j25YAAAAIBAJ&sjid=BPgDAAAAIBAJ&dq=charles%20mcculloch%20stadium%20willamette&pg=2987%2C1234425|accessdate=29 June 2013|newspaper=[[The Bulletin (Bend)|The Bulletin]]|date=August 2, 1958|location=Bend, Ore|page=2}} Around 1970 the track surface was converted to an asphalt and rubber surface, which was resurfaced in the 1980s.{{cite news|title=Track back to proper length|last=Gault|first=Roy|date=March 28, 2001|work=Statesman Journal|pages=1B}} McCulloch Stadium went through a major renovation in 1993.[http://www.salemhistory.net/education/willamette_university.htm Salem Online History: Willamette University] After renovations, the field was named Ted Ogdahl Field in honor of the former coach while the locker rooms were dedicated in the honor of Jeff Knox. In October 1997, [[Liz Heaston]] became the first female to play in a college football game, kicking two extra points in the [[1997 Linfield vs. Willamette football game|game]] at McCulloch against [[Linfield College]].{{cite news|title=Called into history|last=Bachman|first=Rachel|date=October 14, 2007|work=[[The Oregonian]]|pages=C1}} A new $300,000 rekotan track surface was installed at the stadium in 2000.{{cite news|title=Willamette gets improvement to athletic facilities|last=English|first=Reid|date=September 22, 2000|work=Statesman Journal}} At that time university officials discovered the previous track was {{convert|6|m|ft}} too long. In 2003 the grass field was removed and a new FieldTurf surface was installed at a cost of $500,000.{{cite news|title=Willamette University 2003-04 highlights|date=May 16, 2004|work=Statesman Journal|pages=2J}} Later that year lights were re-installed at McCulloch at a cost of $110,000.{{cite news|title=McCulloch Stadium|last=English|first=Reid|date=October 1, 2003|work=Statesman Journal|pages=4B}} A new video scoreboard was added at the facility in 2007.{{cite news|title=Permit issue slows WU scoreboard plans|last=Hagan|first=Chris|date=September 26, 2007|work=Statesman Journal}} ==Sports== The stadium hosts a variety of sports. These include lacrosse,[http://wulax.ialax.com/index.php?section=facilities Willamette University Men's Lacrosse] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929045138/http://wulax.ialax.com/index.php?section=facilities |date=2007-09-29 }} football, soccer, and track meets.[http://www.trackcity.org/meets.htm Track City Track Club - USATF Youth Track & Field Club] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070102182109/http://trackcity.org/meets.htm |date=2007-01-02 }} McCulloch can seat 2,500 spectators. All seats at the stadium are in the covered grandstand on the west side of the playing surface. The grandstands include a press box, offices for the coaches, player locker rooms, and athletic training facilities.{{cite journal|date=2007|title=Bearcat Football 2007 Media Guide|publisher=Willamette University|page=5|url=http://www.willamette.edu/athletics/teams/football/media_guide/2007-08/2007%20fb%20media%20guide.pdf}} McCulloch includes the eight lane [[Charles Bowles]] Track for the school's track teams. The stadium also host [[high school]] football games, including OSAA playoff games.{{cite news|title=Class 5A matchups|date=December 2, 2006|work=[[Statesman Journal]]|pages=Sports p. 4}} ==References== [[File:McCulloch Stadium field.JPG|thumb|Field from the east]] {{Reflist|33em}} == External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060901075908/http://www.willamette.edu/dept/scheduling/facilities/outdoor/mcculloch/ Information and photos at Willamette University] {{coord|44.929838|-123.037627|region:US_type:landmark|display=title}} {{Willamette University}} {{Oregon college football venues}} {{Premier Development League stadiums}} [[Category:Sports venues in Oregon]] [[Category:College football venues]] [[Category:Willamette Bearcats football]] [[Category:Athletics (track and field) venues in Oregon]] [[Category:College track and field venues in the United States]] [[Category:Soccer venues in Oregon]] [[Category:Sports venues completed in 1950]] [[Category:Willamette University campus]] [[Category:Tourist attractions in Salem, Oregon]] [[Category:American football venues in Oregon]] [[Category:1950 establishments in Oregon]]

revision.text:
{{other uses}} [[image:Pallaeh vetulonia 2001 (a).jpg|thumb|250px|"Palla eh!" game in [[Vetulonia]], 2001]] '''Palla''' ([[Italian (language)|Italian]] for ''ball'') is a traditional [[Tuscany|Tuscan]] ball game played in villages between [[Siena]] and [[Grosseto]]. It is also called '''palla EH!''' (or '''pallaeh!''') because players call out ''eh!'' before serving.
Small handmade balls contain a lead pellet wrapped in rubber and wool with a leather cover. The game is played by facing teams who strike (not catch) the ball with either a bare or gloved hand. Courts are marked out with painted lines on town streets, but there is no net, and players can move between sides. Adjacent buildings, objects, and sometimes spectators, are considered "in play." Play does stop for oncoming automobiles. Similar to [[real tennis]], a second bounce can result in a "chase" rather than an outright point, marked in chalk where the ball stops rolling.
Scoring is identical to that of tennis (15-30-40-game). In the variant called '''pallaventuno''' (or '''palla 21''') each game counts as 7, and a set is won with three games (7 for the first, 14 for the second, and 21 for the third, hence the name given to the game). In the other variant, games are simply counted in progression (game 1, game 2). '''Pallacorda''' (or '''palla della corda''') is an extinct form of the game where a cord was strung across the street. [[Pisa]], [[Prato]], [[Rome]], Siena, and various Tuscan towns still have streets named ''via Pallacorda'' or ''via Della Corda''.
==Historical significance==
Palla is of interest to those who study the history of tennis, as it provides some insight into the development of the more contemporarily popular sport. Given the similarities of scoring and the use of chases, it is highly likely palla and tennis share a common sporting ancestor, the various games of palla being more primal in form.
The fact that real tennis was originally played without [[racquet]]s is well documented. The name of the sport in [[French (language)|French]] is [[jeu de paume]], or ''game of the palm'' (of the hand). However, the development of the net is documented less well. In real tennis the net is also referred to sometimes as "the line." Palla eh! uses only a line painted on the ground to mark territory, and this is probably all it was originally. The cord was added for pallacorda probably just to keep the players on their respective sides of the court, and a ball that went under the cord, yet across the line, was probably still a fair shot. Later illustrations of pallacorda and tennis show tassels hung from the cord to indicate if a ball went below the cord. The net was merely an enhancement on the tassels, and it now serves three functions: marking territory, controlling player movement, and restricting the flight of the ball. When modern [[tennis|lawn tennis]] adopted real tennis' net, it also brought with it these three functions.
The fact that variants of palla are all street games, and that they are clearly related to real tennis suggests something of the development of the latter sport's court. It had been assumed that a real tennis court developed from the layout of monastery [[cloister]]s. This is mainly due to the early popularity of the game among clerics, and similarities of some court features to a cloister. However, this theory has two problems. Cloisters are usually square, while a tennis court is much longer than it is wide. Secondly, some of the similar features of tennis courts were actually introduced in the 16th century, and earlier layouts were less similar to cloisters. The study of palla has led many to suggest that the first tennis courts were made by those who wanted to play the street game, but could afford a more private and much cleaner setting. Similarities to cloisters in later court designs could either be coincidence, or intentional innovations. The proportions of the court and features such as penthouses and windows could easily relate to medieval streets.
==Locations currently hosting the game==
The game is still practiced today in six villages in Southern Tuscany. Normally the game is played from Spring through Summer. Tournaments are held in each village between July and August. The actual schedule of the tournaments is confirmed each year a few weeks before its start.
*[[Ciciano]], in the Municipality of [[Chiusdino]] ([[Provincia di Siena|SI]]), the first week-end of August. *[[Piloni]], in the Municipality of [[Roccastrada]] ([[Provincia di Grosseto|GR]]), the second or third week-end of August (depending on agreements with Torniella) *[[Scalvaia]], in the Municipality of [[Monticiano]] (SI), the last week-end of July *[[Torniella]], in the Municipality of Roccastrada (GR), the second or third week end of August (depending on agreements with Piloni) *[[Vetulonia]], in the Municipality of [[Castiglione della Pescaia]] (GR), usually the last week-end of August *[[Tirli]], in the Municipality of [[Castiglione della Pescaia]] (GR), either around mid-July or after Vetulonia.
==See also== * [[pallone]] * [[puellad]] * Dutch ''Kaatsen'' * [[Valencian pilota]]
==References==
* Morgan, Roger (1989). "European Derivatives of Tennis" in ''The Royal Game'', L. St J. Butler & P. J. Wordie, ed. Stirling: [[Falkland Palace Royal Tennis Club|Falkland Palace Real Tennis Club]]. {{ISBN|0-9514622-0-2}} or {{ISBN|0-9514622-1-0}}. * McNicoll, Kathryn (2005). ''Real Tennis'', pp. 21–22. Buckinghamshire: [http://www.shirebooks.co.uk/ Shire Publications]. {{ISBN|0-7478-0610-1}}. * Whitman, Malcolm D. (1932). ''Tennis: Origins and Mysteries'', p. 85. Mineola, NY: [[Dover Publications]] (2004 reprint). {{ISBN|0-486-43357-9}}.
==Links== * [http://www.attivarti.org/palla21/?page_id=102 Explanations from the palla21.it web site] A brief description of the game with various visuals from recent games

'''Rollen Fredrick Stewart''' (born February 23, 1944), also known as '''Rock'n Rollen''' and '''Rainbow Man''', is a man who was a fixture in [[United States|American]] sports culture best known for wearing a [[rainbow]]-colored [[afro]]-style [[Wig (hair)|wig]] and, later, holding up signs reading "[[John 3:16]]" at [[stadium]] sporting events around the United States and overseas in the 1970s and 1980s.<ref>[http://www.straightdope.com/columns/read/457/whats-with-those-john-3 What's with those "John 3:16" signs], The Straight Dope</ref> He is serving three life sentences in a California prison after being convicted of multiple kidnapping charges after a 1992 incident.
==Publicity== Stewart became a [[Born again (Christianity)|born-again Christian]], and was determined to "get the message out" via television. His first major appearance was at the [[1977 NBA Finals]]; by the time of the [[1979 Major League Baseball All-Star Game|1979 MLB All-Star Game]], broadcasters actively tried to avoid showing him.<ref name="Kenyon">{{cite news |url=http://www.seattlepi.com/allstar/30179_1979game06.shtml?rand=80222.2 |title=Real action in '79 was outside the lines |author=J. Michael Kenyon |date=July 6, 2001 |publisher=[[Seattle Post-Intelligencer]] |accessdate=2007-09-24}} Note: Article refers to 1984 Olympics, which were in Los Angeles, not Moscow.</ref> He "appeared behind NFL goal posts, near Olympic medal stands, and even at the [[Augusta National Golf Club]]." At the [[1982 Indianapolis 500]], he was behind the pits of race winner [[Gordon Johncock]].<ref>1982 Indianapolis 500 television broadcast, [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC Sports]], May 30, 1982</ref> Stewart would strategically position himself for key shots of plays or athletes.<ref name="Gazette"/> Stewart's fame led to a [[Budweiser (Anheuser-Busch)|Budweiser]] beer commercial and a ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' parody sketch,<ref name="Gazette"/> where he was portrayed by [[Christopher Walken]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://snltranscripts.jt.org/89/89k.phtml |title=Season 15, Episode 11 |publisher=SNL Transcripts |accessdate=2007-09-24}}</ref>
Stewart was briefly jailed by [[Moscow]] police at the [[1980 Summer Olympics]].<ref name="Kenyon"/> In the late 1980s, he began a string of [[stink bomb]] attacks. Targets included [[Robert Schuller]]'s [[Crystal Cathedral]], the [[Orange County Register]], the [[Trinity Broadcasting Network]], and a Christian bookstore.<ref name="Gazette"/> The stated intent of an attempted attack at the [[American Music Awards]] was to show the public that "God thinks this stinks."<ref>Gorightly, Adam (1999). {{Kooks Museum|page=rainbow|name="Somewhere Over the Rainbow, Man"|sep=,}}. Retrieved on 2008-01-13</ref>
==Arrest== Stewart was arrested in 1992 after a standoff in a [[California]] hotel during which he entered a vacant room with two men he was attempting to kidnap and surprised a maid who then locked herself in the bathroom. Reportedly, Stewart believed that the [[Rapture]] was due to arrive in six days.<ref name="People"/> During the standoff, he threatened to shoot at airplanes taking off from nearby [[Los Angeles International Airport]], and covered the hotel room windows with "John 3:16" placards.<ref name="Gazette"/>
Stewart is currently serving three consecutive life sentences in prison on kidnapping charges,<ref name="Kenyon"/> having rejected a plea deal of 12 years in order to spread his message in open court. After being sentenced, he began a religious tirade and had to be restrained by bailiffs.<ref name="ESPN">{{cite news | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ot7J025JS5U | title=Rollen Stewart: A Colorful Testimony | publisher=[[ESPN]] | date=2004-07-23 | accessdate=2009-02-18}}</ref> He became eligible for parole in 2002, but was denied as recently as March 2010; his next parole review was to be in 2017.<ref name="Gazette">{{cite news | url=http://www.gazette.com/sports/stewart-1836-john-hotel.html | title=What he preached, he didn't practice | publisher=[[Colorado Springs Gazette]] | date=2005-12-14 | accessdate=2012-06-30}}</ref><ref name="Gino">{{cite web | url=http://john3-16signs.com/Gino_s_news.html | title=Gino's News | work=John 3:16 Sign Ministry | date=March 19, 2010 | accessdate=May 17, 2012 | author=Emmerich, Gino}}</ref> After this conviction, he was found guilty of four stink bomb attacks.<ref name="Gazette"/>
Stewart ran a [[blog]] until the time of his parole denial.<ref name="Gordon">{{cite news|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/nba/story/7167852 |title=Favorites for a fan's Hall of Fame |publisher=[[Fox Sports (USA)|Fox Sports]] |date=2007-09-03 |accessdate=2007-09-24 |author=Jeff Gordon |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070907085320/http://msn.foxsports.com/nba/story/7167852 |archivedate=September 7, 2007 }}</ref> He is the subject of the 1997 documentary ''Rainbow Man'', directed by [[Sam Green (filmmaker)|Sam Green]].<ref>{{imdb title|0138051|The Rainbow Man/John 3:16}}</ref>
==Personal life== Stewart was married four times, most notably to Margaret Hockridge. The two met at a church in [[Virginia]] in 1984. They began traveling across the country together in 1985. While on the road, they married in [[St. Louis]] in 1986. During the [[1986 World Series]], Hockridge said that Stewart tried to choke her for standing in the wrong spot with a John 3:16 sign. They divorced in 1990, but kept in touch for many years.<ref name="People">Rich, Katherine Russell. [http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20109199,00.html End of the Rainbow]. ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'', 1992-11-30.</ref>
==References== * "End of the Rainbow" ''People Weekly''. New York: Nov 30, 1992.Vol.38, Iss. 22; pg. 97 (703 word profile of Stewart) * "Rockin' Rollen, A Fan Only of God, Takes a Message to Every Game" Adelson, Suzanne. ''People Weekly''. New York: Feb 1, 1988.Vol.29, Iss. 4; pg. 45 * "Russians Meet Gate-Crasher" AP. ''New York Times''. (Late Edition (East Coast)). New York, N.Y.: Jul 22, 1980. pg. B.14 (226 word article on Stewart at Moscow Olympics) * "Sports World Specials; Resiliency Under the Rainbow No Relief in Sight Striking Out Give Her Credit Punching Doesn't Pay" Jim Benagh. ''New York Times'' (1857-Current file). New York, N.Y.: Aug 18, 1980. p. C2 (10 paragraphs about Stewart and his rainbow wig) * "Briefing" James F. Clarity & Warren Weaver Jr.. ''New York Times'' (1857-Current file). New York, N.Y.: Nov 27, 1985. p. B6 (four paragraphs about Stewart, his wig, and his lawsuit for the right to hang his John 3:16 banner)
==Notes== {{reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.straightdope.com/classics/a2_186.html Rollen Stewart] at ''[[The Straight Dope]]'' (1987) * [http://www.straightdope.com/classics/a971107.html Rollen Stewart] at ''[[The Straight Dope]]'' (1997 update) * {{Kooks Museum|page=rainbow|name=Rollen Stewart}} * {{IMDb title|id=0138051|title=Rainbow Man}} * Los Angeles Times May 19, 2008 [http://www.latimes.com/sports/columnists/la-sp-crowe19-2008may19,0,538254.column]

revision.text:
{{Infobox beverage | name = Street King | image = [[File:Street King energy drink logo.png|200px]] | caption = | type = [[Energy drink]] | manufacturer = Street King LLC | distributor = | key people = 50 Cent | origin = | introduced = 2011 | discontinued = | colour = | flavour = Strawberry lemonade, grape, berry, pomegranate | variants = | related = | website = {{URL|http://www.skenergyshots.com}} }} '''Street King''' was a flavored energy drink created by American rapper [[50 Cent|Curtis “50 Cent” Jackson]] and Pure Growth Partners, CEO Chris Clarke.
==Overview== Jackson partnered with Pure Growth Partners' Founder and CEO Chris Clarke to launch the product,<ref name="hiphopwired">{{cite web|first=Danielle |last=Canada |url=http://hiphopwired.com/2011/08/12/50-cent-releasing-%E2%80%9Cstreet-king%E2%80%9D-energy-shots-proceeds-to-feed-1-billion-children/ |title=50 Cent Releasing "Street King" Energy Shots, Proceeds To Feed 1 Billion Children |publisher=Hip-Hop Wired |date=2011-08-12 |accessdate=2012-07-04}}</ref> which through the [[World Food Programme|United Nations World Food Programme (WFP)]], was intended to provide a meal for a child in Africa with each shot purchased. The product was manufactured and distributed by Street King LLC in [[New York, NY]].
The drink is sold in {{Convert|74|ml|USoz|adj=on}} [[Shot glass|shots]] which contain a [[caffeine]] amount of 285 mg,<ref>http://www.skenergyshots.com/product/</ref> comparable to that of 2-3 cups of coffee.<ref name="hiphopwired"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://coffeetea.about.com/od/caffeinehealth/a/How-Much-Caffeine-Is-In-Coffee-Tea-Cola-And-Other-Drinks.htm|title=How Much Caffeine Is in Coffee, Tea, Cola and Other Drinks?|author=Lindsey Goodwin|work=About.com Food|accessdate=13 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite press release|url=http://www.bevindustry.com/articles/84898-rapper-launches-energy-shot-with-philanthropic-edge |title=Rapper launches energy shot with philanthropic edge |publisher=Beverage Industry |date=2011-08-11 |accessdate=2012-07-04}}</ref> Street King is available in orange-mango and grape.<ref name="hiphopwired"/>
==Philanthropy== In September 2011, Jackson publicly committed to donating one billion meals to the World Food Program over five years. If he reaches this goal, Jackson would become the 20th largest donor to the organization.<ref>{{cite web|last=Horowitz |first=Steven J. |url=http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.16411/title.50-cent-launches-energy-shot-street-king-to-help-feed-one-billion-children |title=50 Cent Launches Energy Shot "Street King" To Help Feed One Billion Children |publisher=HipHop DX |date=2011-08-12 |accessdate=2012-07-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/506247/50-cent-visits-famine-victims-in-somalia-kenya |title=50 Cent Visits Famine Victims In Somalia, Kenya - The Juice |publisher=Billboard.com |date= |accessdate=2012-07-04}}</ref><ref name=goldberg/> Each meal is covered by a 10 cent donation to the World Food Program for each shot purchased.<ref name=goldberg/> He donated 3.5 million meals<ref name=goldberg>{{cite web|first=Mark Leon |last=Goldberg |url=http://www.undispatch.com/why-50-cent-is-a-humanitarian-genious |title=Why 50 Cent is a Humanitarian Genius |publisher=UN Dispatch |date=2012-02-23 |accessdate=2012-07-04}}</ref> between the launch in September 2011 and January 2012.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/street-king-the-popular-energy-shot-with-a-mission-to-end-world-hunger-is-now-available-at-gnc-and-more-than-40000-locations-nationwide-136841283.html |title=Street King, The Popular Energy Shot With a Mission to End World Hunger, is Now Available at GNC and More Than 40,000 Locations Nationwide |publisher=[[PR Newswire]] |date=2012-01-06 |accessdate=2012-10-04}}</ref>
==Marketing== Street King was rebranded as "SK Energy" in summer 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bevnet.com/news/2012/street-king-rebranded-as-sk-energy |title=Off the Street: 50 Cent’s Energy Shot Rebranded as SK Energy |publisher=BevNET.com |date=2012-05-18 |accessdate=2012-07-04}}</ref> Street King was marketed heavily over social media, including videos with [[Pauly D]] and [[Joan Rivers]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Vena |first=Jocelyn |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1681974/50-cent-pauly-d-joan-rivers-street-king.jhtml |title=50 Cent Recruits Pauly D, Joan Rivers For Street King Campaign - Music, Celebrity, Artist News |publisher=MTV.com |date=2012-03-28 |accessdate=2012-07-04}}</ref>
The drink had gained a number of celebrity endorsements, including [[Joan Rivers]];<ref>{{Cite web |title=50 Cent Recruits Pauly D, Joan Rivers For Street King Campaign |first=Jocelyn|last=Vena |work=[[MTV News]] |date=2012-03-28 |accessdate=2014-12-04 |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1681974/50-cent-pauly-d-joan-rivers-street-king}}</ref> [[Pauly D]];<ref>{{Cite web |title=Pauly D Joins 50 Cent's SK Energy Movement |first=Rob |last=Markman |work=[[MTV News]] |date=2012-07-12 |accessdate=2014-12-04 |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1689447/pauly-d-50-cent-sk-energy-drink}}</ref> [[Free Agent]] [[Wes Welker]];<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stack.com/2012/12/01/street-king-energy/ |title=50 Cent's Street King Energy Links With Wes Welker |work=[[Stack magazine]] |date=2012-12-01 |accessdate=2013-07-10}}</ref> [[Erin Andrews]];<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/erin-andrews-talks-50-cent-discusses-near-awkward-kiss-daytona-500-video-1115091 |title=Erin Andrews Talks 50 Cent: Discusses Near-Awkward Kiss At Daytona 500 |publisher=[[International Business Times]] |date=2013-03-07 |accessdate=2015-01-13}}</ref> [[J. R. Smith]] of the [[Cleveland Cavaliers]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/zackomalleygreenburg/2013/03/27/50-cents-next-beverage-bonanza/ |title=50 Cent's Next Beverage Bonanza |publisher=[[Forbes]] |date=2013-03-27 |accessdate=2013-07-10}}</ref>
==Losing Money and Closing== SK Energy was losing "millions" of dollars per year, according to Jackson's accountant, in July 2015.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/crime/50-cent-fails-provide-financial-records-sex-tape-trial-article-1.2301999|title=50 Cent's accountant knows little about rapper's income|work=NY Daily News|access-date=2018-04-10|language=en}}</ref> The company made no known mention of further donations to the World Food Program. As of April 2018, the company's website was not available, social media posts had been removed from [https://www.facebook.com/SKEnergyShot/ Facebook], no mention of the company was available on Pure Growth Partners' website, and the product was not available on Jackson's [https://www.gunitbrands.com/collections/g-unit online store].

{{About|the cricket bowling technique||Swing (disambiguation)}} {{multiple issues| {{cleanup|reason=POV, OR, subjective comments|date=August 2016}} {{lead too short|date=August 2016}} {{manual|date=August 2016}} {{recentism|date=August 2016}} {{refimprove|date=July 2016}} }} {{EngvarB|date=July 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2016}}
{{Bowling techniques sidebar |expanded=all}} '''Swing bowling''' is a technique used for [[bowling (cricket)|bowling]] in the sport of [[cricket]]. Practitioners are known as swing [[bowler (cricket)|bowlers]]. Swing bowling is generally classed as a subtype of [[fast bowling]].
==Physics== [[File:Bart King c1908cr.jpg|left|thumb|The [[Philadelphian cricket team|Philadelphians']] [[Bart King]] helped to perfect swing bowling in the early 20th century{{Citation needed|date=May 2009}}]] The essence of swing bowling is to get the [[cricket ball]] to deviate sideways as it moves through the air towards or away from the [[batsman]]. To do this, the bowler makes use of six factors:
* The raised seam of the cricket ball * The angle of the seam to the direction of travel<ref>Penrose, J.M.T., Hose, D.R. & Trowbridge, E.A. (1996) Cricket ball swing: a preliminary analysis using computational fluid dynamics. In: S.J. Haake (Ed.)The Engineering of Sport. A.A. Balkema, Rotterdam, pp. 11–19.</ref> * The wear and tear on the ball * The polishing liquid used on the ball * The speed of the delivery * The bowler's action
The asymmetry of the ball is encouraged by the constant polishing of ''one side'' of the ball by members of the [[fielding positions in cricket|fielding]] team, while allowing the opposite side to deteriorate through wear and tear. With time, this produces a marked difference in the aerodynamic properties of the two sides <ref>{{Cite journal |doi = 10.1007/BF02844161|title = An overview of cricket ball swing|journal = Sports Engineering|volume = 8|issue = 4|pages = 181–192|year = 2005|last1 = Mehta|first1 = Rabindra D}}</ref>.
Both turbulent and laminar airflow contribute to swing. Air in laminar flow separates from the surface of the ball earlier than air in turbulent flow, so that the ''separation point'' moves toward the front of the ball on the laminar side. On the turbulent flow side it remains towards the back, inducing a greater [[lift (force)|lift]] force on the turbulent airflow side of the ball. The calculated net lift force is not enough to account for the amount of swing observed. Additional force is provided by the [[pressure-gradient force]].
To induce the pressure-gradient force the bowler must create regions of high and low [[static pressure]] on opposing sides of the ball. The ball is then "sucked" from the region of high static pressure towards the region of low static pressure. The [[Magnus effect]] uses the same force but by manipulating spin across the direction of motion. A layer of fluid, in this case air, will have a greater velocity when moving over another layer of fluid than it would have had if it had been moving over a solid, in this case the surface of the ball. The greater the velocity of the fluid, the lower its static pressure.
[[File:Off break small.gif|thumb|Animation of an inswinger bowl from a right arm over the wicket bowler to a right arm batsman.]] When the ball is new the seam is used to create a layer of turbulent air on one side of the ball, by angling it to one side and spinning the ball along the seam. This changes the separation points of the air with the ball; this turbulent air creates a greater coverage of air, providing lift. The next layer of air will have a greater velocity over the side with the turbulent air due to the greater air coverage and as there is a difference in air velocity, the static pressure of both sides of the ball are different and the ball is both 'lifted' and 'sucked' towards the turbulent airflow side of the ball.
When the ball is older and there is an asymmetry in roughness the seam no longer causes the pressure difference, and can actually reduce the swing of the ball. Air turbulence is no longer used to create separation point differences and therefore the lift and pressure differences. On the rough side of the ball there are scratches and pits in the ball's surface. These irregularities act in the same manner as the dimples of a golf ball: they trap the air, creating a layer of trapped air next to the rough side of the ball, which moves with the surface of the ball. The smooth side does not trap a layer of air. The next layer of air outward from the ball will have a greater velocity over the rough side, due to its contact with a layer of trapped air, rather than solid ball. This lowers the static pressure relative to the shiny side, which swings the ball. If the scratches and tears completely cover the rough side of the ball, the separation point on the rough side will move to the back of the ball, further than that of the turbulent air, thereby creating more lift and faster air flow. This is why a new ball will swing more than an old ball. If the seam is used to create the turbulent air on the rough side, the tears will not fill as quickly as they would with laminar flow, dampening the lift and pressure differences.
Reverse swing occurs in exactly the same manner as conventional swing, despite popular misconception. Over time the rough side becomes too rough and the tears become too deep – this is why golf ball dimples are never below a certain depth, and so "conventional" swing weakens over time; the separation point moves toward the front of the ball on the rough side. When polishing the shiny side of the ball, numerous liquids are used, such as sweat, saliva, sunscreen, hair gel (which bowlers may apply to their hair before a game) and other illegal substances like Vaseline (applied to the clothing where the ball is polished). These liquids penetrate the porous surface of the leather ball. Over time the liquid expands and stretches the surface of the ball (which increases the surface area meaning more lift) and creates raised bumps on the polished side, due to the non-uniform nature of the expansion. The valleys between the bumps hold the air in the same manner as the tears on the rough side. This creates a layer of air over the shiny side, moving the separation point towards the back of the ball on the shiny side. The greater air coverage is now on the shiny side, giving rise to more lift and faster secondary airflow on that side. There is therefore lower static pressure on the shiny side, causing the ball to swing towards it, not away from it as in conventional swing.
The rough side tears hold the air more easily than the shiny side valleys, so to maintain the air within the valleys the initial air layer must have a very high velocity, which is why reverse swing is primarily, but not necessarily, achieved by fast bowlers. Due to the less static nature of the initial air layer it takes longer for the swing to occur, which is why it occurs later in the delivery. This is why conventional and reverse swing can occur in the same delivery.
Cold and humid weather are said to enhance swing. Colder air is denser and so may affect the differential forces the ball experiences in flight. When looking at humidity, changes between 0% and 40% humidity appear to have little to no effect on the ball's swing; yet, when approaching 100% humidity "condensation shock" has been observed enhancing the swing of the ball <ref>http://rramakrishnan.com/H/000/Tamil/Articles-Mod/Cricket%20Ball%20Aerodynamics.pdf</ref>.
==Conventional swing== [[File:James Anderson bowl.jpg|200px|left|thumb|[[Jimmy Anderson (cricketer)|Jimmy Anderson]], a swing bowler for the England cricket team]] Typically, a swing bowler aligns the seam and the sides of the ball to reinforce the swing effect. This can be done in two ways: *'''[[Outswinger]]''': An outswinger to a right-handed batsman can be bowled by aligning the seam slightly to the left towards the slips and placing the roughened side of the ball on the left. To extract consistent swing, a bowler can also rotate his wrist toward the slips while keeping his arm straight. To a right-handed batsman, this results in the ball moving away to the [[Fielding (cricket)#Off and leg side fields|off side]] while in flight, usually outwards from his body. *'''[[Inswinger]]''': An inswinger to a right-handed batsman can be bowled by aligning the seam slightly to the right and placing the roughened side of the ball on the right. To extract consistent swing, a bowler can also rotate or "open up" his wrist towards leg slip. To a right-handed batsman, this results in the ball moving in to the [[leg side]] while in flight, usually inwards towards his body.
The curvature of swing deliveries can make them difficult for a batsman to hit with his [[cricket bat|bat]]. Typically, bowlers more commonly bowl outswingers, as they tend to move away from the batsman, meaning he has to "chase" the ball to hit it. Hitting away from the batsman's body is dangerous, as it leaves a gap between the bat and body through which the ball may travel to hit the [[wicket]]. Also, if the batsman misjudges the amount of swing, he can hit the ball with an edge of the bat. An inside edge can ricochet on to the wicket, resulting in him being out bowled, while an outside edge can fly to the [[wicket-keeper]] or [[slip (cricket)|slip]] fielders for a catch.
An inswinger presents relatively fewer dangers to the batsman, but on some particular days can be devastating due to risk of being bowled or [[leg before wicket]]. [[Shane Bond]] was considered a great exponent of inswing bowling.
An inswinger combined with a [[yorker]] can be especially difficult for the batsman to defend against, especially if used as a surprise delivery after a sequence of outswingers.
There has been a distinct lack of left-arm swing bowlers in the game.<ref>{{cite book|title=Mid-Wicket Tales: From Trumper to Tendulkar|url=https://books.google.com/?id=IPwjBAAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false|first1=S|last1=Giridhar|first2=V. J.|last2=Raghunath|publisher=[[SAGE Publications]]|date=2014|page=115|isbn=9789351500902}}</ref> Some of the most famous left-arm bowlers were [[Pakistan national cricket team|Pakistan's]] [[Wasim Akram]], [[India national cricket team|India's]] [[Zaheer Khan]], [[Australia national cricket team|Australia's]] [[Alan Keith Davidson|Alan Davidson]] and [[Sri Lanka national cricket team|Sri Lanka's]] [[Chaminda Vaas]].
==Reverse swing== {{redirect|Reverse swing|reverse swing in doors|Door}} Normal swing occurs mostly when the ball is fairly new. As it wears more, the aerodynamics of the asymmetry changes and it is more difficult to extract a large amount of swing. When the ball becomes very old—around 40 or more overs old—it begins to swing towards the shine. This is known as ''reverse swing''—meaning a natural outswinger will become an inswinger and vice versa.<ref name="guardian2005">[https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2005/aug/18/ashes2005.ashes2 How England reversed a losing trend | Sport | The Guardian<!-- reflinks title -->]</ref> In essence, both sides have turbulent flow, but here the seam causes the airflow to separate{{Clarify|date=January 2010}} earlier on one side. The result is always a swing to the side with the later separation, so the swing is away from the seam.
Reverse swing tends to be stronger than normal swing, and to occur late in the ball's trajectory. This gives it a very different character from normal swing, and because batsmen experience it less often, they generally find it much more difficult to defend against. It is also possible for a ball to swing normally in its early flight, and then to alter its swing as it approaches the batsman. This can be done in two ways<ref name="Cricinfo">http://www.espncricinfo.com/magazine/content/story/499176.html</ref> one for the ball to reverse its direction of swing, giving it an 'S' trajectory: the other is for it to adopt a more pronounced swing in the same direction in which the swing is already curving; either alteration can be devastating for the batsman. In the first instance, he is already committed to playing the swing one way, which will be the wrong way to address swing which is suddenly coming from the opposite direction: in the second instance, his stance will be one which is appropriate for the degree, or extent, of the expected swing, and which could suddenly leave him vulnerable to [[Leg before wicket|LBW]], being caught behind, or bowled. Two consecutive deliveries from Wasim Akram, one of each type, were considered to be the turning point of the [[1992 Cricket World Cup Final|1992 World Cup Final]].<ref name="Cricinfo"/>
Pioneers and notable practitioners of reverse swing have mostly been Pakistani fast bowlers. In the early days of reverse swing, Pakistani bowlers were suspected of [[ball tampering]] to achieve the conditions of the ball that allow reverse swing. According to [[Shahryar Khan|Shaharyar Khan]], reverse swing was invented by Salim Mir, who played for the Punjab Cricket Club in [[Lahore]] and taught it to his team-mate [[Sarfraz Nawaz]].<ref>[[Shahryar Khan|Shaharyar M. Khan]] and Ali Khan, ''Cricket Cauldron'', I.B. Tauris, London, 2013, p. 180.</ref> Sarfraz Nawaz introduced reverse swing into international cricket during the late 1970s, and passed their knowledge on to their team-mate [[Imran Khan]],<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/cricket/england/4155734.stm BBC SPORT – Cricket – England – What is reverse swing?]</ref> who in turn taught the duo of [[Wasim Akram]] and [[Waqar Younis]]. The English pair of [[Andrew Flintoff]] and [[Simon Jones (cricketer)|Simon Jones]], having been taught by [[Troy Cooley]] and the Indian bowlers like [[Zaheer Khan]] and [[Ajit Agarkar]], are also well known for the ability to reverse swing.<ref>[http://www.thewisdencricketer.com/item.php?parent_id=3&child_id=0&item_id=294 Forgotten Hero] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081216124419/http://www.thewisdencricketer.com/item.php?parent_id=3&child_id=0&item_id=294 |date=16 December 2008 }}</ref> Bowlers tend to disguise the direction of reverse swing by running up starting with the opposite hand before switching hands and covering the ball for as long as possible before release. [[Neil Wagner]] utilizes this to show the ball is reversing, but disguises the direction of swing.
==Playing swing bowling== Playing swing bowling is considered to be a hallmark of a batsman's skill.
Firstly, a batsman needs good eye reflexes which are considered to be a key skill when facing swing bowling. Secondly a batsman often needs to anticipate ''beforehand'' what the ball will do and adjust accordingly to play swing bowling. This can be done by observing the bowler's grip and action (which may have a marked difference depending on which type of swinger is to be delivered), by observing the field set, which may depend on the types of deliveries expected (as a rule outswingers will have more slips assigned) or by means of prior knowledge of the bowler; many can bowl or are proficient in only one type of swing. Traditional methods include the batsmen playing the ball as late as possible, and not playing away from the body. Other effective measures for combating swing bowling include standing well outside the crease, thus giving the ball less time to swing; and guessing the direction of swing based on the seam position observed in the ball's flight.
Since reverse swing occurs at faster speeds, later in the trajectory of the ball and with no real obvious change in action and grip (Waqar Younis from Pakistan for example had the same action and grip for nearly all his deliveries.
Controversy regarding reverse swing has never left modern cricket, as the Pakistani team was accused of [[ball tampering]] by the Australian umpire [[Darrell Hair]] during the [[Pakistani cricket team in England in 2006#Fourth Test .2817–20 August.29|fourth test against England in 2006]] when the ball began to reverse swing after the 50th over.<ref>[http://content-uk.cricinfo.com/engvpak/content/current/story/257055.html Cricinfo – As the chaos unfolded]</ref> His co-umpire Billy Doctrove supported him. A hearing subsequently found that there was insufficient evidence to convict anyone of ball tampering.<ref>[http://www.cricinfo.com/ci/content/story/260776.html?CMP=OTC-RSS ''"I therefore conclude, (1) Mr ul-Haq is not guilty of the charge of ball-tampering..."'']</ref>

as Barbara Crain * [[Bill Owen (actor)|Bill Owen]] as Sam * [[Edward Underdown]] as Geoffrey Tyler * [[Robert Morley]] as Lord Logan * [[Honor Blackman]] as Mrs Tyler * Fella Edmonds as Georgie Crain Richards]] as Jockey {{div col end}} ==Reception== The film premiered at the [[Odeon Leicester Square]] in London on 27 May 1954,[http://find.galegroup.com/ttda/infomark.do?&source=gale&prodId=TTDA&userGroupName=kenlib&tabID=T003&docPage=article&searchType=&docId=CS33772219&type=multipage&contentSet=LTO&version=1.0 The Times, 27 May 1954, page 2: ''Classified - Picture Theatres - Odeon Leic. Sq. - The Rainbow Jacket''] Linked 2015-07-06 and the reviewer for ''[[The Times]]'' wrote that, "''It is, then, an entertaining film, a film in love with racing and yet not quite so devotedly so as to refrain from suggesting that in the running of the [[St. Leger]] there can be some very queer goings-on indeed.''"[http://find.galegroup.com/ttda/infomark.do?&source=gale&prodId=TTDA&userGroupName=kenlib&tabID=T003&docPage=article&searchType=BasicSearchForm&docId=CS68506299&type=multipage&contentSet=LTO&version=1.0 The Times, 27 May 1954, page 4: ''Odeon Ceinama - "The Rainbow Jacket"''] Linked 2015-07-06 Sixty years after the premiere, ''[[TV Guide]]'' felt that "''a trite outcome mars this fairly entertaining film, which features real-life British racing figures [[Raymond Glendenning]] and [[Gordon Richards]],''"{{cite web|url=http://movies.tvguide.com/the-rainbow-jacket/review/115359 |title=The Rainbow Jacket Review |publisher=Movies.tvguide.com |date= |accessdate=2014-04-03}} while ''[[Time Out (magazine)|Time Out]]'' noted that the film was "''the first collaboration between Dearden and [[TEB Clarke]] after [[The Blue Lamp]]...Despite its intriguing subject, the film offers little but the cosy, sentimental view of life that is typical of late Ealing films.''" ==References== ==External links== * {{BFI Explore| 4ce2b6b3dc8e6 |The Rainbow Jacket}} * {{BBFC title| aff005991 |The Rainbow Jacket}} * {{imdb title|0047390|The Rainbow Jacket}} {{Basil Dearden}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rainbow Jacket, The}} [[Category:1954 films]] [[Category:1950s sports films]] [[Category:British films]] [[Category:British drama films]] [[Category:British sports films]] [[Category:Ealing Studios films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Films directed by Basil Dearden]] [[Category:Horse racing films]] [[Category:Films scored by William Alwyn]] [[Category:Films set in London]] {{1950s-UK-film-stub}}

{{DISPLAYTITLE: ''Toby Tortoise Returns''}} {{Infobox Hollywood cartoon | cartoon_name = Toby Tortoise Returns | series = [[Silly Symphonies]] | image = | caption = | director = [[Wilfred Jackson]] | story_artist = [[William Cottrell]]
[[Joe Grant]]
